H0.text: The theoretical yield is the value used as the denominator when calculating the percent yield, which is determined by taking the ratio of the actual yield to it.

H1.text: Past balance is the value used to determine the percent yield by calculating the ratio of the actual yield to it.

H2.text: Predicted return is the value used to determine the percent yield by calculating the ratio of actual yield to it.

H3.text: Actual loss is the denominator used to calculate the percent yield, which is determined by the ratio of actual yield to actual loss.

A4.text: The ratio of the theoretical yield and the actual yield results in a percent yield.

A5.text: The % yield is calculated from the actual molar yield and the theoretical molar yield (1.5 mol รท 2.0 mol ร 100% = 75%).
